phq9.title: PHQ-9 Depression Screening
phq9.description: A 9-question assessment to evaluate symptoms of depression over the past 2 weeks. Takes about 3-5 minutes.
phq9.q1: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
phq9.q3: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
phq9.q4: Feeling tired or having little energy
phq9.q6: Feeling bad about yourself — or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
phq9.q7: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
phq9.q8: Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite — being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
phq9.q9: Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
gad7.title: GAD-7 Anxiety Screening
gad7.description: A 7-question assessment to measure anxiety symptoms and their severity. Takes about 2-4 minutes.
gad7.q1: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
gad7.q2: Not being able to stop or control worrying
gad7.q3: Worrying too much about different things
gad7.q5: Being so restless that it's hard to sit still
gad7.q7: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen
rec.minimalDepression1: Your responses suggest minimal or no depression symptoms
rec.minimalDepression2: Continue maintaining healthy habits like regular exercise and sleep
rec.minimalDepression4: Stay connected with friends and family
rec.minimalDepression5: Consider periodic self-check-ins to monitor your well-being
rec.mildDepression1: Your responses suggest mild depression symptoms
rec.mildDepression2: Consider talking to a trusted friend, family member, or peer counsellor
rec.mildDepression3: Explore our self-help resources and relaxation techniques
rec.mildDepression4: Establish a regular sleep schedule and exercise routine
rec.mildDepression5: If symptoms persist for more than 2 weeks, consider booking an appointment with a counsellor
rec.moderateDepression1: Your responses suggest moderate depression symptoms
rec.moderateDepression2: We recommend speaking with a mental health professional
rec.moderateDepression3: Book an appointment with a campus counsellor
rec.moderateDepression4: Practice daily self-care activities and mindfulness
rec.moderateDepression5: Reach out to our peer support community for additional support
rec.moderateDepression6: Consider informing a trusted person about how you're feeling
rec.moderatelySevereDepression1: Your responses suggest moderately severe depression symptoms
rec.moderatelySevereDepression2: It's important to seek professional support soon
rec.moderatelySevereDepression3: Please book an appointment with a counsellor as soon as possible
rec.moderatelySevereDepression4: Consider reaching out to a mental health helpline
rec.moderatelySevereDepression5: Don't hesitate to talk to someone you trust about how you're feeling
rec.moderatelySevereDepression6: Our AI chat support is available 24/7 for immediate coping strategies
rec.severeDepression1: Your responses suggest severe depression symptoms
rec.severeDepression3: Contact a mental health crisis helpline if needed
rec.severeDepression4: Book an urgent appointment with a counsellor
rec.severeDepression5: Reach out to a trusted friend, family member, or faculty
rec.severeDepression6: Remember: You are not alone, and help is available
rec.minimalAnxiety1: Your responses suggest minimal anxiety symptoms
rec.minimalAnxiety3: Maintain regular physical activity and sleep habits
rec.minimalAnxiety4: Try breathing exercises to stay calm during stressful times
rec.minimalAnxiety5: Consider periodic self-assessments to stay aware of your mental health
rec.mildAnxiety1: Your responses suggest mild anxiety symptoms
rec.mildAnxiety2: Practice relaxation techniques like deep breathing or meditation
rec.mildAnxiety3: Explore our guided relaxation audio resources
rec.mildAnxiety4: Limit caffeine intake and ensure adequate sleep
rec.mildAnxiety5: Talk to a peer supporter or trusted friend if worries persist
rec.moderateAnxiety1: Your responses suggest moderate anxiety symptoms
rec.moderateAnxiety2: Consider speaking with a mental health professional
rec.moderateAnxiety3: Book an appointment with a campus counsellor
rec.moderateAnxiety4: Practice daily mindfulness and grounding exercises
rec.moderateAnxiety5: Reduce exposure to stress triggers when possible
rec.moderateAnxiety6: Our peer support community can provide additional help
rec.severeAnxiety1: Your responses suggest severe anxiety symptoms
rec.severeAnxiety2: Please seek professional support as soon as possible
rec.severeAnxiety3: Book an appointment with a counsellor urgently
rec.severeAnxiety4: Consider contacting a mental health helpline
rec.severeAnxiety5: Practice grounding techniques when feeling overwhelmed
rec.severeAnxiety6: Reach out to someone you trust for immediate support
